meanings.def: a sweet spread made from grape juice thickened with sugar and pectin
meanings.example: She spooned grape jelly over the warm biscuits for breakfast.

meanings.def: juice pressed from grapes and served as a beverage or recipe ingredient
meanings.example: We poured chilled grape juice for the kids at the picnic.

meanings.def: an aphid that infests grapevines and damages their roots and leaves
meanings.example: The vineyard was inspected for any sign of the destructive grape louse.

meanings.def: a tiny aphidlike insect (Daktulosphaira vitifoliae) that attacks grapevine roots and foliage
meanings.example: Growers monitor new plantings carefully to keep grape phylloxera away.

meanings.def: glucose occurring naturally in grapes, honey, and many fruits
meanings.example: Grape sugar provides the quick energy that fuels fermenting yeast.

meanings.def: a climbing woody vine of the genus Vitis cultivated for clusters of grapes
meanings.example: The old grape vine along the fence still produces fruit every summer.

meanings.def: a South African begonia with lobed leaves resembling grape foliage and delicate white blooms
meanings.example: She keeps a grape-leaf begonia in the bright corner of the sunroom.

meanings.def: approximately the size of a typical grape
meanings.example: Tiny grape-sized hailstones bounced across the patio.

meanings.def: a large citrus fruit with thick yellow rind and tart, juicy segments
meanings.example: He sprinkled sugar on half a grapefruit for breakfast.

meanings.def: a citrus tree (Citrus × paradisi) that bears large round fruit with tart pulp
meanings.example: The grapefruit in the orchard were almost ready to pick.

meanings.def: juice extracted from grapefruits and served as a drink or mixer
meanings.example: Fresh grapefruit juice brightened the brunch menu.

meanings.def: strips of grapefruit rind cooked in syrup and often coated in sugar
meanings.example: Candied grapefruit peel made a fragrant garnish for the cake.

meanings.def: resembling grapes in shape, clusters, or flavor
meanings.example: The plant produced small grapelike berries that birds loved.

meanings.def: a cluster of small metal balls fired together from a cannon
meanings.example: The fort's defenders unleashed grapeshot as the attackers closed in.

meanings.def: an informal network through which news or gossip spreads quickly
meanings.example: Word of the promotion reached her through the office grapevine.

meanings.def: a climbing vine of the genus Vitis that produces grapes
meanings.example: A single grapevine shaded the porch with lush leaves.

meanings.def: the plant family Vitaceae, which includes grapes and Virginia creeper
meanings.example: Botany students compared berries from several members of the grapevine family.

meanings.def: having a flavor or aroma reminiscent of fresh grapes
meanings.example: The young wine was light, grapey, and easy to drink.

meanings.def: a diagram that plots relationships between quantities along axes or coordinates
meanings.example: The sales graph showed steady growth across the quarter.

meanings.def: to plot or represent data on a diagram
meanings.example: Students graphed the experiment results to look for trends.

meanings.def: paper printed with a grid of evenly spaced lines for plotting points or drawing diagrams
meanings.example: She sketched the floor plan on graph paper before remodeling.

meanings.def: the smallest unit of a writing system that represents a sound or meaningful element
meanings.example: The letter "c" is a grapheme that can stand for different sounds.

meanings.def: described with vivid, often unsettling detail
meanings.example: The documentary included graphic accounts of the storm's destruction.

meanings.def: relating to drawing, printing, or visual design
meanings.example: She studied graphic techniques to improve her poster layouts.

meanings.def: involving diagrams or charts
meanings.example: The report offered a graphic summary of the survey data.

meanings.def: an image or illustration produced especially by a computer
meanings.example: The video game's opening graphic set the tone for the adventure.

meanings.def: visual art that creates designs or illustrations through drawing, printmaking, or digital media
meanings.example: The exhibition highlighted graphic art from emerging illustrators.

meanings.def: a professional who produces visual designs or illustrations
meanings.example: The company hired a graphic artist to refresh its packaging.

meanings.def: the practice of planning and creating visual communication that combines text, imagery, and color
meanings.example: She specializes in graphic design for nonprofit campaigns.

meanings.def: a person who practices graphic design professionally
meanings.example: A freelance graphic designer developed the festival's posters.

meanings.def: a written or printed sign that stands for an idea, sound, or process
meanings.example: The recycling graphic symbol is instantly recognizable worldwide.

meanings.def: the mineral sylvanite, a silver-gold telluride with a metallic luster
meanings.example: The assay identified the dark streaks as graphic tellurium.

meanings.def: relating to visual art or computer-generated imagery
meanings.example: The film's graphical style mixes hand-drawn and digital elements.

meanings.def: expressed or presented in diagrams or charts
meanings.example: The engineer gave a graphical explanation of the load limits.

meanings.def: information displayed as a chart, diagram, or similar visual record
meanings.example: The patient monitor prints a graphical record of heart rhythms.

meanings.def: a computer interface that uses icons, menus, and windows instead of text commands
meanings.example: The app's graphical user interface is easy to navigate by touch.

meanings.def: in vivid or explicit detail
meanings.example: Survivors graphically described the chaos after the quake.

meanings.def: by means of diagrams or visual representations
meanings.example: The teacher explained the formula graphically on the whiteboard.

meanings.def: the visual elements such as images and typography used in a layout
meanings.example: Bold graphics made the brochure stand out at the trade show.

meanings.def: computer-generated images or design work
meanings.example: The game's 3D graphics impressed even seasoned players.

meanings.def: a soft crystalline form of carbon used in pencils, lubricants, and nuclear reactors
meanings.example: The mechanic dusted the lock with graphite to keep it turning smoothly.

meanings.def: a person who analyzes handwriting to draw conclusions about character or aptitude
meanings.example: A graphologist was invited to examine the historic letters.

meanings.def: the study or practice of interpreting handwriting to assess personality or ability
meanings.example: Graphology remains controversial despite its long history in job screening.

meanings.def: a cramp or spasm of the hand brought on by writing
meanings.example: After hours of note-taking he felt a sharp graphospasm in his fingers.

meanings.def: a small anchor or multi-pronged hook used to seize or hold something
meanings.example: They tossed a grapnel over the rail to secure the drifting dinghy.

meanings.def: a lightweight anchor with several curved hooks for mooring small craft or retrieving objects
meanings.example: The kayaker dropped a grapnel anchor to stay near the reef.

meanings.def: a dry Italian spirit distilled from grape pomace
meanings.example: He ended the meal with a tiny glass of grappa.

meanings.def: to seize or wrestle with someone at close quarters
meanings.example: The defenders grappled with the intruder until security arrived.

meanings.def: to struggle to understand or solve something difficult
meanings.example: Communities are still grappling with how to rebuild after the floods.

meanings.def: a close, hand-to-hand struggle
meanings.example: The match ended in a tense grapple near the edge of the mat.

meanings.def: a hooked device used for seizing or dragging objects
meanings.example: Divers used a heavy grapple to haul the debris to the surface.

meanings.def: a person who wrestles or specializes in grappling techniques
meanings.example: The veteran grappler controlled the bout from the opening move.

meanings.def: a device with hooks used to grasp or lift objects
meanings.example: A hydraulic grappler cleared the fallen branches from the road.

meanings.def: the sport or act of close wrestling in which opponents try to control one another
meanings.example: He won the tournament with disciplined grappling and quick transitions.

meanings.def: a multi-pronged hook thrown or lowered to catch onto a surface
meanings.example: The rescue team fired a grappling hook onto the ledge.

meanings.def: a sturdy grappling hook made of metal for seizing or holding
meanings.example: Sailors swung a grappling iron across to pull the boats together.

meanings.def: having the taste or fragrance of ripe grapes
meanings.example: The juice was simple, sweet, and grapy.

meanings.def: to take firm hold of something
meanings.example: She grasped the railing as the train lurched forward.

meanings.def: to understand something clearly
meanings.example: It took a while to grasp how the new policy would work.

meanings.def: a firm hold
meanings.example: His grasp on the suitcase never loosened during the trip.

meanings.def: the range of someone's knowledge or power
meanings.example: Advanced calculus lay beyond her grasp at the time.

meanings.def: easy to understand or take in mentally
meanings.example: The trainer broke the task into graspable steps for beginners.

meanings.def: excessively eager to acquire wealth or possessions
meanings.example: The film portrays the landlord as a grasping opportunist.

meanings.def: plants with narrow leaves and jointed stems that form lawns or pastures
meanings.example: Morning dew sparkled on the grass covering the hillside.

meanings.def: to cover land with turf or growing grass
meanings.example: The city plans to grass the new playground once grading is complete.

meanings.def: the common soil bacterium Bacillus subtilis, often found on hay and vegetation
meanings.example: Spores of the grass bacillus survive harsh winter conditions in the field.

meanings.def: the plant family Poaceae, which includes cereals, bamboos, and lawn grasses
meanings.example: Wheat, corn, and barley all belong to the grass family.

meanings.def: an epiphytic fern with narrow grasslike fronds, especially species of Vittaria
meanings.example: The greenhouse displays a grass fern hanging from the rafters.

meanings.def: any of several small finches of open grasslands, many with bright plumage
meanings.example: A flock of grass finches fluttered through the seed heads at dusk.

meanings.def: the common European frog (Rana temporaria) that frequents meadows and ponds
meanings.example: We spotted a grass frog sheltering beneath the moss.

meanings.def: to become or cause to become covered with grass
meanings.example: If left alone, the dirt path will grass over by next summer.

meanings.def: the budgerigar, a small Australian parakeet usually green with black and yellow markings
meanings.example: The aviary's grass parakeet entertained visitors with cheerful chirps.

meanings.def: a North American orchid (Calopogon tuberosus) bearing fragrant pink flowers
meanings.example: Hikers were delighted to find a grass pink blooming in the bog.

meanings.def: an aquatic herb (Lythrum portula) with creeping stems and small pink flowers
meanings.example: Grass poly thrives in the shallow edges of the pond.

meanings.def: ordinary people in a community who form the foundation of political or social movements
meanings.example: The campaign relied on grass roots volunteers to reach voters.

meanings.def: the basic source or underlying level of something
meanings.example: Researchers looked at the grass roots causes of the shortage.

meanings.def: a skirt made from long strips of dried grasses or plant fibers
meanings.example: Dancers wore a grass skirt over brightly colored wraps.

meanings.def: a harmless European snake (Natrix natrix) with a yellow collar and olive body
meanings.example: We quietly watched a grass snake slip into the pond.

meanings.def: an Australian plant of the genus Xanthorrhoea with a woody stem and tuft of long narrow leaves
meanings.example: The grass tree sent up a tall flower spike after the fire passed.

meanings.def: the group of Australian plants in the subfamily Xanthorrhoeoideae of the Asphodelaceae
meanings.example: Field guides treat the grass tree family as a distinct section of the flora.

meanings.def: a slender annual vetch (Lathyrus nissolia) with grasslike leaves and reddish flowers
meanings.example: Grass vetch clings to the hedgerows each spring.

meanings.def: a common name for Lathyrus nissolia, noted for its narrow leaves and small red blooms
meanings.example: We spotted grass vetchling scattered through the meadow.

meanings.def: a woman whose spouse or partner is absent for an extended period
meanings.example: During the long deployment she joked about being a grass widow.

meanings.def: a man whose spouse or partner is away for an extended time
meanings.example: He became a grass widower while his wife studied overseas.

meanings.def: submerged seagrass (Zostera marina) with long ribbonlike leaves found in coastal waters
meanings.example: Eelgrass beds of grass wrack shelter young fish along the bay.

meanings.def: feeding primarily on grasses or other herbaceous plants
meanings.example: Bison are powerful, grass-eating grazers of the prairie.

meanings.def: a North American wildflower (Pityopsis graminifolia) with narrow leaves and yellow daisylike blooms
meanings.example: A patch of grass-leaved golden aster brightened the sandy slope.

meanings.def: any bog plant of the genus Parnassia bearing white, veined, buttercup-like flowers
meanings.example: The trail crosses wetlands filled with grass-of-Parnassus in late summer.

meanings.def: an Australian finch of open grasslands, such as species of the genus Poephila
meanings.example: A grassfinch perched on the fence and flashed its orange bill.

meanings.def: a fast-moving wildfire that burns through dry grasses
meanings.example: Fire crews raced to contain the grassfire before it reached the houses.

meanings.def: a plant-eating insect with long hind legs adapted for jumping
meanings.example: A grasshopper launched itself from the garden fence.

meanings.def: a sweet cocktail made with crème de menthe, crème de cacao, and cream
meanings.example: She ordered a grasshopper for dessert instead of cake.

meanings.def: a small carnivorous North American rodent of the genus Onychomys
meanings.example: The grasshopper mouse hunts insects across the desert at night.

meanings.def: open land dominated by grasses and few trees
meanings.example: Prairie chickens depend on intact grassland for nesting.

meanings.def: lacking a cover of grass
meanings.example: The drought left wide grassless patches in the park.

meanings.def: resembling grass in appearance or texture
meanings.example: Tufts of grasslike sedges bordered the pond.

meanings.def: originating among or carried out by ordinary people rather than leaders
meanings.example: A grassroots campaign persuaded the council to expand transit service.

meanings.def: fundamental or basic in nature
meanings.example: The team proposed grassroots reforms to rebuild trust.

meanings.def: covered with or abundant in grass
meanings.example: They picnicked on a grassy hillside overlooking the lake.

meanings.def: a highly toxic lilylike plant (Toxicoscordion venenosum) native to western North America
meanings.example: Ranchers learn to spot grassy death camas to keep livestock away.
